entry.title: France's Macron and Far-Right Le Pen Lead in First Round of Presidential Election
entry.content: President Emmanuel Macron won the first round with 28.5% of the vote ahead of Marine Le Pen with 24.2%, according to exit polls, setting the stage for a closely contested runoff.

entry.title: Ukraine, Russia Gear Up for War's Biggest Battles
entry.content: The countries poured reinforcements into eastern Ukraine, as refugees fled the looming Russian assault. Unlike the first part of the war, with its guerrilla tactics, officials expect large-scale tank and artillery battles for the eastern Donbas region.

entry.title: Israel's 'War Between the Wars' With Iran Expands Across the Middle East
entry.content: The Israeli military says it has carried out more than 400 airstrikes targeting Iran and its allies.

entry.title: Shanghai Has Recorded More Than 130,000 Covid Cases---and No Deaths
entry.content: With 25 million people in lockdown, Shanghai has reported no deaths and says currently only one case is severe.

entry.title: Fleeing Putin, Thousands of Educated Russians Move Abroad
entry.content: Young professionals, often working in tech, have left the country after the Ukraine invasion: “I can’t live in a country that goes to war with its neighbors.”
